intro: Packera loratifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf paintbrush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has basal leaves that are broadly ovate to lanceolate in shape, often with hairy surfaces. It typically grows in moist meadows and along streambanks, preferring cool, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of alpine and subalpine ecosystems.
